definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: The NOAH 12 railcars are transport railcars between the different bases underground.
sentences.chinese: 諾亞基地12個車皮的地下交通軌道車之間的不同。

sentences.english: A railway truck carries about 60 tons.
sentences.chinese: 一節火車車皮大約能載60噸貨物。

sentences.english: All girders shipped by rail were arranged on a flatbed rail car.
sentences.chinese: 由火車裝運的所有主樑都安放在平板火車車皮上。

sentences.english: Railroad cars sitting on dock, loaded with timber.
sentences.chinese: 碼頭上載滿木頭的車皮。

sentences.english: Old fashioned locomotive and loaded cars standing on dock, emitting steam.
sentences.chinese: 碼頭上散發着蒸汽的老式火車頭和已經裝載的車皮。

sentences.english: So they loaded up a wagon with all their things.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他們裝了一車皮與所有的東西。

sentences.english: The locomotive was pulling (or drawing) twelve carriages .
sentences.chinese: 火車頭拖着十二個車皮。

sentences.english: The gifts to him would have filled a railway car .
sentences.chinese: 送給他的禮物將會裝滿一節火車車皮。
